Editor - Celebrations


Reviewed/ reviewed.com , a part of theUSA TODAY NETWORK,is seeking a professional journalist experienced in quick-turnaround journalism to join us as a full-time Editor covering Celebrations content, including holiday, wedding, graduation, and monthly celebration coverage (such as Pride Month and Womens History Month).

The ideal candidate will have a deep curiosity about the world and an appreciation for smart service journalism. Youll be part of a rapidly growing team and responsible for shaping daily content that enriches peoples lives. Youll have a chance to share your work across the USA TODAY Network and beyond.

Our mission is to help people buy the best stuff and love what they already own. We do this by providing our audience informative, enjoyable, and genuinely useful content.

This position requires editorial experience and a hunger for determining what is true about a product and what is just marketing hype. Previous experience with affiliate links is a plus. This is a full-time, salaried role working 40 hours per week. Our ideal candidate will be an experienced editor who demonstrates an understanding of quick-turnaround content production, possesses excellent project management skills, and has a strong commitment to journalistic ethics.

This role will also require attendance on certain holidays or big sales, including but not limited to Black Friday, Cyber Monday, Amazon Prime Day, and CES.

Reviewed is one of the most influential sources on the internet when it comes to reviews of products like appliances, consumer technology, lifestyle products, and more. Youll learn on the job and become a key contributor to a team of talented, like-minded product nerds.

The Editor role reports to the Executive Editor, Commerce. We are open to remote employees, but staffers are also able to work out of our (truly awesome) labs in Cambridge, MA.



Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain a robust strategy for Celebration content for the year, including a schedule for wedding- and holiday-related content.
  • Assign and edit features per week to staff writers or freelance writers.

  • Work within your teams editorial workflow to guide stories from pitch to publication in a timely manner.
  • Recruit and manage freelance writers.
  • Work alongside analytics team to identify high-performing content.
  • Produce work in the appropriate CMS, with the proper formatting, image selection or creation, and link building.
  • Be available to work during holidays and major sales, including but not limited to Black Friday, Cyber Monday, Amazon Prime Day, and CES.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor's or masters degree in communications, journalism, marketing or related field or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Experience editing and producing high-quality, rapid-turnaround editorial content.
  • Ability to quickly edit stories to be clear and succinct.
  • An understanding of readers needs, shopping habits, and budget constraints.
  • A basic understanding of consumer search trends and shopping habits, especially with regard to celebration events and weddings.
  • Competitive drive to be a leading editorial voice.
  • An understanding of journalistic ethics and commitment to upholding high ethical standards.
  • Basic photo-editing skills and experience with programs like PhotoShop or Canva is a plus.
  • Knowledge of SEO best practices.
  • Experience with affiliate networks, like Amazon Affiliates, Skimlinks, Impact Radius, Trackonomics, or others is a plus.
